Vel Koz is fucking fine the way he is. Millions of people have said so. And yet Riot continues to push this with their arrogant "We know better than you" attitude.

I'm genuinely curious as to why anyone would think that Vel'Koz needs changing. I've never seen any whining about him nor have I seen many buffs or nerfs coming his way. Maybe someone can convince me otherwise, but to me, it seems like they're just tweaking him for absolutely no reason at all.

Vel was held as the epitome of balance. That's why you never heard anyone cry for buffs or nerfs.
The change is because he had no niche. His only out-put was magic damage, with minimal CC and negligible true damage, So he ended up competing with every magic damage champion for competitive value. Meaning he was either the strongest damage option, or he wasn't picked.

I'm at least going to brag that I saw the out-come of this change. Mages (as a class) never had a good option for dealing with tanks. Thanks to a truck-load (Assumed, haven't seen the numbers) of true damage, Vel can now fill that role. Meaning there is a reason to pick him, even if he isn't the #1 source for magic damage.
For reference, Brand had near the same problem. Notice that they're lining him up as the AoE damage option (He just jumped from 2 to 4 AoE abilities). Similiarly, Xerath, Ziggs, and Lux all competed pretty closely for the Siege position. Lux managed to stand out thanks to her utility (And notice she gets used a lot more because of it), while Ziggs and Xerath are effectively identical. It looks like they intend to reinforce Ziggs as a turret seiger (Satchel charge) and Xerath as a champion seiger (Barrage charges).

None of these class updates are specifically about any champion being strong or weak. It is about giving them all a unique reason to be played. Whether the changes succeed/fail to reinforce what the community likes about them is a different matter, or succeed/fail to break them is a different discussion.

Your reaction was my initial reaction to mah fave mid laner/mage jungle, that he would be broken af, then I had a long, hard think about it.
Yes, there is potential for an absolute F*CKTONNE of true damage from our tentacle pal, however it is not free true damage that some other champs can dish out just cos they can, looking at you yi, pre-nerf fiora, irelia and pre-nerf vayne.

Currently (before these changes take place) vel'koz get's on relatively fine in today's meta, with enough true damage to bust open hexdrinkers/wittle down tanks and the utility to be somewhat useful when behind. His base damages are high enough to make building allot of magic pen viable in the absence of good ap ratios, and he has the self peel/ build path to kite for his team; rylais, liandries, void staff, sorc shoes ect. The koz has also been in a very good spot balance wise for a very long time (which is more than I can say for allot of champions in this game, who're either OP, UP or broken AF). That is, he has his good match ups (twisted fate/melee ap), bad match ups(akali, azir(IMO)) and those in between (zed, LB, ahri). But doesn't completely pub stomp a team 1V5 off of 1 kill and is actually pretty fun to play against.

As for their changes. The scaling true damage. I don't really see as an issue here. As they have reduced his ap ratios on his w and e by a decent amount and his ult no longer gives free procs for secures when they're out of q range. And all of his ratios were pretty average to begin with. The result here will be players either opting for a full ap build, relying on landing their full combo and killing people with the ult. Or playing it standard with magic pen, leaving the "disgusting" true damage on his ult/passive much to be desired. Maintaining his rightful spot as a utility mage.
As for the w/e changes, this will weaken the laneing phase a lil of a vel'koz who can't proc his passive on the enemy lander. As he won't be able to clear waves for eternity, and for free while pressuring the enemy/having enough mana for self peel at the same time.

The ult changes. As first, same reaction as you. And tbh I'm still a lil edgy about 7 seconds. However that buys a lil time to get into a better position/ for ult to come off CD. And since there is now SO MUCH  riding on landing your entire combo on everyone b4 ulting, that kinda balances itself out in the difficulty aspect. Risk=mess up combo, your team dies. Reward= LCS BIG PLAYZ!

And finally. I've seen some say that they've made him overloaded/difficult to balance with these changes. I beg to differ. They have directly taken damage out of his base kit (w and e) and transferred this damage to the ult and passive. If it turns out he is in fact OP AF, they can simply do this. Lets say that the issue foreseen is in fact the true damage. They could take say 10-15% (I'm just picking numbers that sound right-ish) of scaling/damage from his passive and/or ult, and transfer them into either base/scaling magic damage on his w and/or e.

Just my verdict. Overall I'm pretty happy with how he's turned out. Just gotta wait and see how his true damage out put seems when he's released.
